intro: Astragalus pseudochlorostachys, commonly known as the pale chlorostachys milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, globular clusters, which are characteristic of the Fabaceae family. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with numerous small, oval-shaped leaflets. Astragalus pseudochlorostachys is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, often found in steppes and rocky soils.
